headline: Warren Buffett Knocked Out Of Top 10 Richest People List Thanks To Walmart
summary: Legendary investor Warren Buffett ended his run as the CEO of Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE:BRK)(NYSE:BRK) at the end of 2025. Buffett may have another long run coming to an end as of Tuesday. Buffett Drops Out Of Top 10 Richest Once the richest person in the world, Buffett finished 2025 ranked 10th at a net worth of $151 billion, up $9.44 billion for the year. Just over one month into 2026, Buffett has fallen out of the top 10 richest people in the world, with Walmart Inc (NYSE:WMT) heir Jim Walton

headline: Walmart Hits US$1t Valuation As Tech Focus And New CEO Draw Scrutiny
summary: Walmart (NasdaqGS:WMT) has reached a market capitalization of US$1t, becoming the first large brick and mortar retailer to hit this level. The valuation milestone comes alongside leadership changes, including John Furner stepping into the CEO role. The company continues to put capital into e-commerce, artificial intelligence, automation and international operations, with a focus on markets such as India. For you as an investor, Walmart now sits at the intersection of traditional retail and...

headline: Steve Madden down 9% as Jefferies downgrades stock on wholesale headwinds
summary: Investing.com -- Steve Madden shares were down 9% on Thursday. Jefferies has downgraded the stock to Underperform and cut its price target to $30, warning that ongoing pressures in the company’s wholesale business could weigh on revenue and margins for multiple quarters.

headline: E.l.f. Beauty CEO talks 'incredible momentum' since Hailey Bieber deal
summary: Cosmetics company e.l.f. Beauty (ELF) is glowing up Thursday morning after releasing strong fiscal third quarter earnings results while raising its full-year guidance. e.l.f. Beauty Chairman and CEO Tarang Amin speaks with Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi about the brand's momentum since acquiring Hailey Bieber's skincare line Rhode last year. Amin also comments on the company's product roadmap, its core business growth, and sales inside major retailers like Costco (COST) and Walmart (WMT). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.
